programme.desc: New York Architect Wendy Fok travels to the remote Guizhou Valley in China to see the Beipanjiang First Bridge, the highest bridge on Earth, which boasts a 20,000 tonne steel deck. Plus, Andrew Steele tracks down a bridge on the thames that nobody thought could ever be built, Suzie Sheehy is in Hampshire climbing the tallest unreinforced concrete town ever built and Luke Bisby scales the Forth Bridge in Edinburgh.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The remains of three U-boats discovered in the Bristol Channel. Their exact identity and how they came to be there is not known, so divers explore the wrecks and with the help of British and German experts reveal the mystery submarines. Series investigating deep-sea wrecks off the south-west coast of England.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: New York Architect Wendy Fok travels to the remote Guizhou Valley in China to see the Beipanjiang First Bridge, the highest bridge on Earth, which boasts a 20,000 tonne steel deck. She soon discovers that trying to straddle a 565 metre gorge so deep that it's known as the 'crack in the Earth', presented huge challenges for its engineers. Plus, Andrew Steele tracks down a bridge on the thames that nobody thought could ever be built, Suzie Sheehy is in Hampshire climbing the tallest unreinforced concrete town ever built and Luke Bisby scales the Forth Bridge in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.desc: Andrea's cover has been well and truly blown, leaving her to face the wrath of Gina and fatally compromising her testimony at the trial of rapist Alan Kennedy, who is acquitted. Desperate for a chance to redeem herself, she makes one last effort to gather incriminating evidence against Gabriel - only to end up being held hostage in a store room by the crazed copper. Events come to a head when Colin is dismissed after being exposed as a vicious racist and retaliates by handcuffing Ken in a petrol-doused van and crashing it into Sun Hill's front office. Blissfully unaware of the escalating crisis, Reg calls Marilyn's mobile phone at the station, intending to ask for her hand in marriage - and triggers a massive explosion.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: In a special episode filmed in Ghana, Diane goes in search of Ric to persuade him to return home. She finds him working in his brother's clinic, the only available source of medical care for the local community, which is in desperate need of funding. An outraged Ric demands she take the first flight back to the UK, declaring that he's needed where he is. But Diane is not convinced his reasons for staying are entirely altruistic, and investigates unresolved conflicts in his family concerning the death of his father. As she prepares to return home, an emergency involving a pregnant woman brings their personal and professional dilemmas to a head. Adrian Edmondson guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The nursing staff undergo self-defence training, but Charlie needs a softly-softly approach to rescue Baz from a gun-toting kidnapper. With Holby A&E accepting emergencies only, Richard plans a career move and paramedic Josh considers adopting Liam until Penny questions his motives.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An inferno sweeps through Sun Hill station in the aftermath of the explosion, giving Gabriel the chance to make good his escape, callously leaving Andrea trapped under fallen debris as the flames creep closer. Dale also faces a fiery demise in the burning building, while Jim struggles to accept the news that his friend Ken was killed instantly when the van blew up. Marilyn fights for life in hospital, a grief-stricken Reg at her bedside - and as he tearfully slips an engagement ring onto her finger, an ominous bleep from her cardiac monitor heralds a tragic end to their relationship.

programme.title: Life on Mars

Blissfully unaware of the escalating crisis, Reg calls Marilyn's mobile phone at the station, intending to ask for her hand in marriage - and triggers a massive explosion.

programme.desc: A forgetful clock-mender contacts the sleuth when he becomes the target of a couple of small-time crooks. Armed with advice from DCI Adams, Hetty starts her investigation at a video store and soon discovers that there is more to the case than meets the eye.

programme.desc: Now that Hetty and her husband are back from their trip to Australia, the Wainthropp Detective Agency can get back to some serious sleuthing. Adapted by Heidi Thomas, with an all-star cast including Judi Dench and Eileen Atkins, who was awarded a Bafta for her role as the authoritative Miss Deborah Jenkyns.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The town's residents prepare for Lady Ludlow's garden party, but the occasion is marred by rumours the railway line will come right into Cranford, leaving Deborah feeling betrayed. Dr Harrison's plans to become better acquainted with Sophy are thwarted by Caroline Tomkinson and Clara Smith, Mr Carter takes pity on an illiterate 10-year-old and Miss Matty is shaken to see a face from her past. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Eileen Atkins.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in the town, but Lady Ludlow regrets any notion of seasonal charity when Mr Carter asks her to intervene in the case of Job Gregson, who has been blamed for a spate of thefts. Miss Matty is delighted when Mr Holbrook invites her to his farm, and Dr Harrison's friend Jack sends Caroline Tomkinson a card hinting she should expect a proposal from the medic. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Miss Matty confides in Mary about Mr Holbrook's death, prompting her to inform Major Gordon of Jessie's regret over not marrying him. Dr Harrison tells Rev Hutton of his intentions toward Sophy and asks permission to court her, blissfully unaware that the generosity he has shown to Mrs Rose has accidentally created an unlikely love triangle. Penultimate episode of the costume drama, starring Judi Dench and Simon Woods.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The true nature of friendship within Cranford is revealed as the ladies rally to help Miss Matty when she receives terrible news. Judi Dench, Philip Glenister and Simon Woods star.

Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Donald Pleasence and Adrian Lukis.

Serial rapist Alan Kennedy demands an interview with Sam Nixon, claiming he has been receiving death threats.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank has a surprise bargain for Nigel, Grant has some bad news for Sharon, and Ian discovers the truth about Cindy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is put on the spot over the future of the Vic. Nigel has his revenge on Frank, Cindy has to make a decision, and Arthur turns to an old friend.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick causes controversy when he criticises the motor industry following a traffic accident. Meanwhile, the fire-fighters are called to a house fire.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: As the Glenbogle cellars fill with water and the bank threatens to call in its loan, Hector stages a rooftop protest. Katrina is tempted by the offer of a new life with Alan, and Justine delivers an ultimatum to Archie - return to London or forfeit his share of the restaurant. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Part two of two. A forger posing as Bergerac enquires about the bank account of a known con-man and is later abducted by a pair of criminals. Crime drama, guest starring Tony Robinson and John Bluthal, with John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Oswald breaks off his engagement to Aveline. Nellie needs some time alone after receiving a worrying letter, and finds solace in a chance encounter with a kindly widower.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted faces the potentially awkward task of hiring an X-rated film for the artistically inclined male campers. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean suspects Lionel is going deaf but has trouble convincing him. Elsewhere, things seem to be going well for Judith and Alistair, while Sandy fears her boyfriend prefers rugby to her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When Eva, a worldly wise former acquaintance of Alvin arrives in the village, while Marina discovers she might have some competition as the apple of Howard's eye. Long running comedy, guest starring Shirley Ann Field.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A priest is murdered in a tiny village, the site of a hugely publicised miracle cure a few weeks earlier, and the crime-solving duo arrive to find a community deeply divided and steeped in superstition. Searching for a likely suspect, they instead discover the body of a girl killed 40 years previously. James Bolam, Lindsey Coulson and Roger Lloyd-Pack guest star, with Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An armoured security van is discovered at the bottom of a lake, and the team makes a link to a disappearance 17 years previously and an unsolved killing, prompting them to reopen the case. Sandra feels she is making progress after finding the murder weapon, but suffers a setback when a key witness is killed. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. DS Boyd investigates whether a woman who confessed to the killing of her husband 25 years ago could be innocent. Startling new facts come to light when Annie Keel's son, now living under a new identity, has to relive the trauma of the night of the murder. Drama, guest starring Lynda Bellingham, with Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The trail of evidence against Colin Fairfax leads Jack Meadows and Jo Masters to a potentially explosive confrontation with him in a lock-up garage full of petrol cans. Yvonne gets wind of Scott's romantic entanglement with Honey and confides in Steve Hunter her suspicions about his cool reaction to the news of his wife's murder. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy demands an interview with Sam Nixon, claiming he has been receiving death threats.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore talks to Piers about his career and personal life, including his spectacular fall from grace in the early 2000s when 31-year-old Stuart Lubbock was found dead in his swimming pool following a party at his home. Barrymore was never charged in relation to the death, but the controversy has dogged his career ever since and he has rarely been seen on television, besides a successful appearance in the 2006 edition of Celebrity Big Brother, where he finished as runner-up. He also talks about his close friendship with Princess Diana, the depths of his drug and alcohol addictions and the moment in which he came out as gay.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Following the suicide of Jeanie Long, the woman convicted of the murder of teenager Abigail Mantel 11 years earlier, new evidence comes to light exonerating her. DCI Vera Stanhope reinvestigates the case, but to find out who really killed Abigail, the detective must uncover the secrets of a close-knit community that is still coming to terms with the incident. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Telling Tales, guest starring Hugo Speer alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Wunmi Mosaku and Paul Ritter.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: The Lake District - The Borrowdale Walk
programme.desc: Setting off from Rosthwaite, a small village in the jaws of Borrowdale, the expert walker takes in the history and landscape of the Cumbrian fells as she heads up the small peak Castle Crag, which stands at less than 1,000ft. The presenter is joined by celebrated mountaineer Chris Bonington, to whom she asks - which is better - Everest or Castle Crag? From the lush green valley floor to magnificent views over Derwent Water, this walk is a great way to take home a lasting memory of the Lake District, and all in under three hours.

programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team turn a suburban plot in Hull into a wildlife retreat for a nature-loving teenager and his family. Plus, tips on creating a pond that is attractive to animals and safe for children, the best small trees to screen an overlooked garden, and a guide putting together an outdoor cinema.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Two couples disappear in the tiny village of Monks Barton amid rumours of witchcraft and haunted woods. As Barnaby and Jones investigate, psychic Cyrus LeVanu clashes with cleric Wallace Stone over their different methods of 'healing' the woods, while other locals seem to be caught up in a stolen antiques racket. When a body is unearthed and the death toll rises, the detectives race to catch the killer by finding a connection between the missing couples and the thefts. Anton Lesser guest stars, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly Come Dancing professional Oti Mabuse, tennis coach Judy Murray and actor-comedian John Thomson to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore and star guests. In this week's show, Ant and Dec are joined in the studio by Rob Brydon, who takes up the role of Star Guest Announcer, while Anne-Marie will be taking to the stage to perform in the End Of The Show Show. Plus, lucky viewers across the UK are surprised with a Place On The Plane and another audience member gets the chance to Win The Ads, and get their hands on every single item featured in the commercial breaks.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (2016)
programme.desc: A remote frontier town falls under the control of a ruthless industrialist, who uses the locals as forced labour in his mines. A woman goes in search of help, recruiting a band of seven hired guns to protect the town and train the people to fight back. Remake of the classic Western, starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pratt.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Animal lover, comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school to welcome Ethel the goat and Fagin the crow, in the hope they can learn to tidy up their toys and put them away in a box. The week's star pupil is Smurf, a Parson Russell terrier who holds the world record of performing the most tricks in a minute. The trainers hit the road to teach an Arab mare called Ruby Ribena to count in the hope she can help turn a little girl's party into a fairy tale.

programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands Mr. Bean drive her and Miss Wince to the spa, and wait outside until they're done. But Bean gets bored, and looks for fun!.

programme.desc: Po sets out to get his chi back and Jing resolves to face Jindiao after a shocking revelation..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Dominica, taking a trip into the wild rainforests to the island's most famous waterfall. He prepares twice-fried plantains on the black sands of Picard Beach, discovers a local recipe using tiny fish that gather in Dominica's rivers, and acquires some cassava bread from the Kalinago community, to serve with his Calypso chicken.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their version of classic Chinese dish crispy duck pancakes, and follow it up with spicy cauli wings with ranch sauce, a herby stew, and their pain au chococake. Their guest is chef Luke Robinson, who prepares miso glazed aubergine.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore and star guests. In this week's show, Ant and Dec are joined in the studio by Rob Brydon, who takes up the role of Star Guest Announcer, while Anne-Marie will be taking to the stage to perform in the End Of The Show Show. Plus, lucky viewers across the UK are surprised with a Place On The Plane and another audience member gets the chance to Win The Ads, and get their hands on every single item featured in the commercial breaks.

programme.title: Uncle Buck (1989)
programme.desc: An unreliable but good-natured slob is called upon to look after his trouble-making nephew and nieces while their parents are away - and what starts as a disaster soon changes for the better as the unlikely babysitter gets to grips with the finer points of being a responsible adult. Family comedy, starring John Candy, Macaulay Culkin, Jean Kelly, Gaby Hoffman, Amy Madigan and Laurie Metcalf.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly Come Dancing professional Oti Mabuse, tennis coach Judy Murray and actor-comedian John Thomson to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the semi-final of the skating contest, in which the celebrities must each perform two routines for judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman in the hope of winning a place in next week's grand final. Plus, a performance by Cirque du Soleil: Crystal.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.sub-title: The Fall of the House of Crockett
programme.desc: Mystery drama set in Bath, where the wildly ambitious DCI McDonald finds herself paired with the shy, modest DS Dodds, who has languished on the shelf for most of his working life. However, it soon turns out the unassuming sergeant has a hidden talent for puzzle solving. Their first case sees the pair looking into the shooting of a homeless man in the deserted mansion of local industrialist Max Crockett. The Crockett appear to be a close-knit group but it soon becomes clear they have secrets to hide. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia star as the detectives, with a guest appearance from Robert Lindsay.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp welcomes celebrity friends to his house in Sandbanks, Britain's most exclusive and expensive seaside resort. In this episode, Harry welcomes John Barnes and Chris Kamara, where they take to the water to see what the area has to offer from the sea. Harry challenges John and Chris to a powerboat showdown on the Solent, before they sample a local delicacy at Harry's favourite chip shop.

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary looking at crash-for-cash scams, joy riders and brazen car thieves - with dramatic video and interviews from victims and eyewitnesses. Police officers reveal how they catch the criminals, and former car thieves expose the tactics used to take vehicles. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport. Staff at Heathrow airport contend with drunken passengers, drugs and drones, while Sue and Demi deal with an extra load of passengers after a closure at Gatwick airport. Elsewhere, Border Force officer Bob returns to the job, working to protect Britain's biggest border.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon invades the homes of one final trio of famous faces, inviting Jonathan Ross, Melanie Sykes and Ashley Banjo to form the panel. As ever, the stars in the studio will be asked to guess which celebrity abode the host has infiltrated, based on a selection of tell-tale clues he picks out from among their possessions.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Dave, Natalie, Jonathon and Janet pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

Laura is trying to move on from her ordeal, but her initial relief upon learning of Andrew's death is cut short when she finds herself drawn into his destructive path and once again she must fight to be believed. The return of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt.
